reviews.review_msg: He was is a helpful instructor.  Shows a lot of videos and not too much lecturing as much as discussion.  Only annoying thing was that 5 weeks into the course is when we actually got an outline, that was ridiculous but he is a good guy and wants you to do well.
Too much reading and a bit scattered
Nice guy.  Heavy reading load.  Helps if you have a background in poli sci or econ.  Rewards thinking and no just regurgitation
Only professors that awards marks for doing the readings. Good prof

The lectureseminars are sooooo long and monotonous but when it comes to assignments he really helps everyone understand the fundamentals of academic research. He also gives you options for your semester project. He might mark harder than a lot of communications profs but you will come out his class a better student.

David is a very pleasant and well read professor.  He challenges you to up your game.  There are a ton of readings, so be prepared to put in a lot of time because you are expected to do the required readings and pick others from your theoretical focus, which there are two throughout the entire course.  Skimming the readings is not enough.
Newman is GREAT yet little bit boring. I like him, such a nice and gentle man.

With David, you have freedom in attending his courses, in picking the recommended readings you prefer, and the liberty to be original in your paper(s) and your presentation(s). David is super helpful, encourages you throughout your project, and brings it to the next level; giving you the chance to publish it.

David is an intelligent and considerate professor who I think is better suited to teaching upper division courses.  I'm lucky enough to have had a chance to be taught by him at two different points in my undergrad degree, and while he was nothing but professional in both instances, his insights in the upper division were much more well received.
Anis is a generous and respected person! He could be strict at times but overall a very good person and CMNS444 is a very good class overal!

Fen is an amazing prof.  Yes, she is soft spoken but her English is very clear and understandable.  More importantly, she is highly intelligent.  She uses great material and is always available for her students.  She has a wide range of knowledge. Just an awesome experience.  Highly recommend her.
Great instructor, extremely knowledgeable...cracks lots of good jokes. :)
Excellent Instructor, Great Sense of humour!

Katherine is a really great prof. There's so much to learn from her and she is truly awesome and caring. Wish there was more assignments to even out the grade weight so assignments aren't worth so much.

Katherine is an AWESOME prof! She is very passionate in the material she teaches and has a way of explaining it to her students that makes difficult concepts appear crystal clear. She is super helpful in office hours and cares a great deal about her students. I would highly recommend her; she has been one of my favourite profs in four years at SFU!

If you are looking for an upper level Cmns class at SFU I HIGHLY recommend taking a class with Fiona Jeffries. I had her this semester for CMNS 444 - Political Economy of International Communication and it was by far one of my favorite classes ever taken at SFU. Engaging, thought provoking, inclusive, up-to-date and discussion/project orientated.
Fiona is an awesome prof! She's really engaged and helpful.
